title: Atanas Mladenov
data: Atanas Mladenov (Bulgarian: Атанас Младенов, born 3 January 1960) is a retired Bulgarian high jumper. He was born in Plovdiv and represented the club Trakia Plovdiv. He competed at the 1980 Olympic Games without reaching the final.[1] He became Bulgarian champion in 1980 and 1981. His championship record of 2.15 metres set in 1980 was improved already in 1981 by Georgi Gadzhev.[2] He also became Bulgarian indoor champion in 1980 and 1982. He equalled the championship record of 2.16 metres but was surpassed by Valentin Getov in 1981.[3] His personal best jump was 2.20 metres, achieved in 1980.[1] This biographical article relating to Bulgarian athletics is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
